description: Parachain consensus KPI and debug metrics

panels.description: Measures how far behind finality is compared to the current best block. By design, GRANDPA never finalizes past last 2 blocks, so this value is always >=2.
panels.title: Relay chain finality lag (last)

panels.description: Measures how far behind finality is compared to the current best block. By design, GRANDPA never finalizes past last 2 blocks, so this value is always >=2.
panels.title: Approval checking finality lag (last)

panels.description:
How far behind the chain head is the last approved and non disputed block. 
This value is always higher than approval checking lag as it further restricts finality to only undisputed 
chains.
panels.title: Effective Disputes Finality Lag (avg)

panels.description: Shows how many times senders blocked when sending messages to subsystems
panels.title: Clogged channels by susbystem

panels.description: The time spent in preparing Parachain Validation Function artifacts in seconds.
panels.title: PVF preparation time (heatmap)

panels.description: Parachain Validation Function execution time distribution.  PVFs are expected to have a limited execution time to ensure there is enough time left for the parachain block to be included in the relay block.
panels.title: PVF execution time (heatmap)

panels.description: Size distribution for messages sent over the validation protocol.
panels.title: Validation peerset notification sizes (OUT)

panels.description: Parachain Validation Function execution time distribution.  PVFs are expected to have a limited execution time to ensure there is enough time left for the parachain block to be included in the relay block.
panels.title: Block import time (relay chain)

panels.description: Parachain Validation Function execution time distribution.  PVFs are expected to have a limited execution time to ensure there is enough time left for the parachain block to be included in the relay block.
panels.title: Block inherent create time (relay chain)

panels.description: Parachain Validation Function execution time distribution.  PVFs are expected to have a limited execution time to ensure there is enough time left for the parachain block to be included in the relay block.
panels.title: Time spent pruning av data

panels.description: Number of candidates seconded and signed statements.
panels.title: Candidate backing

panels.description: Number of erasure-encoded chunks of data belonging to candidate blocks.
panels.title: Availability

targets.expr:
sum(increase(polkadot_parachain_candidate_validation_validate_from_chain_state_bucket{chain="$chain", node=~".*validator.*"} [$__rate_interval])) by (le) +
sum(increase(polkadot_parachain_candidate_validation_validate_from_exhaustive_bucket{chain="$chain", node=~".*validator.*"} [$__rate_interval])) by (le) +
sum(increase(polkadot_parachain_candidate_validation_validate_candidate_exhaustive_bucket{chain="$chain", node=~".*validator.*"} [$__rate_interval])) by (le)

panels.description:
Approval voting requires that validators which are assigned to check a specific 
candidate are split up into delay tranches (0.5s each). Then, all validators checks are ordered by the delay 
tranche index. Early tranches of validators will check the candidate first and later tranches act as as backups in case of no shows.
panels.title: Assignment Delay Tranches (per block)
Average Assignments, approvals and no shows observed per validator

panels.description: Parachain Validation Function execution time distribution.  PVFs are expected to have a limited execution time to ensure there is enough time left for the parachain block to be included in the relay block.
panels.title: Time to recover and check candidate (heatmap)

panels.description: This covers the full time it takes to: recover candidate available data from other validators; check the candidate; issue statement or initiate dispute
panels.title: Time to Recover and Check Candidate

title: Parachains - Liveliness
